meanings.definition: The amount that a shelf can hold.
meanings.sent1: I bought so many books that they filled several shelffuls in my bookcase.
meanings.sent2: The library had shelffuls of books on various topics for visitors to borrow.
meanings.sent3: My friend joked that she needed shelffuls of storage space just for her shoe collection.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing shelffuls of toys in the playroom made it difficult to walk around.
meanings.sent5: The chef needed shelffuls of spices to create his signature dish.

meanings.sent1: The store had a sale on books, so I ended up buying multiple shelffuls.
meanings.sent2: She organized her collection of DVDs into neat shelffuls on the entertainment unit.
meanings.sent3: The kids were amazed by the shelffuls of candy at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The shelves were filled with shelffuls of colorful yarn for the knitting club.
meanings.sent5: The farmer harvested shelffuls of ripe apples from the orchard.
